reviews.review: This game is so epic that my computer can't even run it. 1000000/10

Some people seem to genuinely enjoy this game.  That caught me off-guard.

In 2007, I'd heard all the hype about this being the next great RPG.  Just coming off Oblivion (which I'd played obsessively), I was so excited for Two Worlds!

Well, I played it about 30 minutes, was horrendously disappointed, laughed at it a bit, and gave up.  It's very pretty.  That's about all I have to say about it.

Recently, seeing all the positive (??) reviews for the game, I grabbed it for $2.  Well, I wish I had my money back.  I gave it another try.  If there is redeeming value in this game, I can't find it.  The combat is awful, it's buggy, the dialog is laughable...

Two Worlds II, on the other hand, is actually underrated.  It's a lot of fun.  That's another reason I gave this game a second shot.  The sequel is so much fun, despite not exactly being brilliant, so maybe I missed something in the original?

Well, again, if I'm missing something, I can't find it.  I have a pretty high tolerance for crappy RPGs, but I can't tolerate this one.

Gran juego  , merece la pena jugar un poco de rpg  . Aunque  hace años de su salida ,  tiene esa historia  y esas misiones alternativas que merecen la pena de hacer , no por  subir nivel  sino por la profundidad .
 En difícil  se pasa mal,   hasta que le encuentras es punto al baile del personaje para que no te golpeén grandes monstruos , siendo mortal , con la mejor armadura que " yo " encontre .  Gran trabajo a  la empresa
This is a very exciting game

A lot of the reviews for this game fail to mention a very important aspect of the game. The combat. It's difficult and i'd barely call it combat. You basically just spam the left mouse button and hope that you actually hit them because hit boxes are almost non existent on enemies.

Fun game for as old as it is. Be sure to go Download the PhysX patch no matter what hardware you're running or how up to date you are. You'll need this or you will not be playing this game. http://www.nvidia.com/content/DriverDownload-March2009/confirmation.php?url=/Windows/9.12.1031/PhysX-9.12.1031-SystemSoftware-Legacy.msi&lang=us&type=Other

I picked this one up figuring it would be an interesting time killer, the rave reviews of "ON PAR WITH OBLIVION!" struck to me and i definately thought it would be an interesting play because of that... im staring at the character creation screen and already im realizing that it is far from it... for one thing it locks you into one gender for character, instantly throwing all character choice out the window for me!

if your going to advertise as being as good as something, do your reasearch and make sure your features are just as good

In many ways i should hate this game. The fps is awful. The combat is clunky and most of all horses go wherever they damn well please. However the game itself is a hugely enjoyable experience with a huge world that is exciting to explore. The gripes such as bad voice acting almost add a level of charm to the game. In so many ways I should hate this game but I really can't help but love it.

WOA!!! Torgue here. Alright listen up vault hunters, I have just started my journey into the world of Antaloor and already its a BEAUTY! Do you like tearing undead monster, wild creatures, or bandits limb from limb using a big two handed sword or even elemental magic like a firey EXPLOSION!?! F@#% YEAH, who doesn't? Well this game has it, set the enemy ablaze with pyromancy or maybe just smash them with your fists. Ah, if only they had Torgue weapons... Anyways I got to go, I invited Tiny Tina over to play Two Worlds and she should be here soon. So if you vault hunters have some free time between killing ancient vault demons and trying to beat Brick in armwrestling, try this game out.

I cannot recommend this game. I want to, very badly, but I cannot. Yes, even for $2.50, not worth it. The Last Remnant is cheaper and a better challenge, no lie. Anyway, this is why this classic should be laid to rest.

Before I could even play the game I ha to download a special driver update because my Windows 7 cannot outwardly play this game. This is despite it being RECOMMENDED as a OS by STEAM. Fail. After the first fifteen minutes was scouring the internet for information I fnally got into the game. Two Worlds was made in 2007, so I forgave the awkward character creation system and lackluster options in hair styles and colors. Even the "great for its time" graphic rendering. For me, however, the big let down came when we got to gameplay.

Anyone else take notice that it uses Diablo I font type? Like to the "T", I wonder if they paid for that font? Anyway, the voice acting began to remind me of a bad early 90's dubbed anime. The actors kept missing inflections of words and botching their lines 'emotionally' and it was just the opening scene! I get to my first objective, kill a few baddies and gain xp and again bad things happen. Three of them come at me, I fire a fireball at the first one then go to swap targets to attack the encroaching second baddie. Wait, how do you change targets? I almost die trying to figure this out and use the awkward "Q: jump forward, E: jump backward" dynamic to slay and burn my enemies to proper pulps and ashes.  Afterwards I take a quick moment to alt-tab to Google to find my answer. The answer? You cannot swap targets. Wait, what? Excuse me? A game that requires me to focus attacks and fight multiple monsters not only hasn't figured out how to "jump and direct" at the same time but doesn't have a simple TARGETING feature?

I'm sure this game was great in 2007, the original Final Fantasy was groundbreaking. Now a days, however, there's so much more that could be and should have been done to this game. The dynamic of spell making and reputation systems are great, but it's really hard to get to that part of this game when it fumbles over every other step. I have Two Worlds II GOTY on my PS3 and a lot of these issues WERE handled. This is why, 2007 was a great year for TW, but not 2014 and not even for $2.50.

It's a very underrated title, often looked down upon because it was somewhat similar to "Oblivion" back in the day. Personally I think of it like a separate series of game, and I like it. It's a big and solid game with lots and lots of content, and many hours of enjoyment. Doesn't look half bad either to be honest, even though it's slightly dated. There's also community patches to fix certain aspects of the game I believe, since the developer has most likely stopped patching the game all together. I like it, and if you like 3rd person action RPG's with a huge open world packed with stuff to do, you will too. 8/10

Own it on disc and played it for ages but didn't mind paying the £1.50 sale price rather than look for it in the cupboard to give it another go. The animations might be a bit ropey but the visuals aren't too bad. The combat could have been done better and feels a bit dated, using the bow is pretty poor, but if you can look beyond it's faults there is a huge game for the tiny price.
 Always liked the way you can combine matching items to boost them up (mouse over them in the inventory and if they match they turn green, then just drag 'n' drop). I would suggest using the 'jump-back' key to avoid enemy attacks and survive combat for longer though, especially at the start, and carry a mix of slashing, piercing and bashing weapons with different elemental upgrades. Horses have their own inventory, just stand next to them and get the panel up, use these to solve your storage problems by gathering a few around a teleport site. Doing this and having different ones for different item types makes it easier to collect armour sets etc and to keep matching items to combine them.
   Huge world, loads of locations to discover, tons of loot, vast number of quests, hacking down creatures while on horseback, if you want an epic rpg experience and give it the chance it deserves you'll soon find yourself ignoring it's failings and find a good game, get it at sale price and you can't go wrong.

Absolute shit.

Lets get the bad stuff out of the way first. BUGS. HOLY MOTHER OF GOD, THEY'RE EVERYWHERE. It's like an infestation of glitches of every kind: graphical (I'll talk about that later.), gameplay, combat and some are even game-breaking. Walk up stairs,  open a chest, and never walk down the stairs again due to the magical power of floating over noble gasses gained in the 11 seconds you spent raiding the poor farmer's pantry. Luckily, the game keeps a good list of autosaves to avoid these issues.

Second biggest problem: the visuals are horrendous. I was walking through what I thought was a field of grass and happiness, when suddenly...bamboo. A whole forest of it, and I was walking through the center of the mighty wilds without even noticing. It took the game 10 minutes to process the enviroment fully. I could understand this if you were playing Mass Effect 3 on a Commodore 64, but with these extremely out-dated and pixely graphics, it should take less than 5 seconds on an average non-gaming computer.

Oh, and don't bother talking to that drunk guy in Four Stones Village. His voice acting is even worse than the cook in the army camp named Bodlo, wh speaks in 3rd person and has the voice of a pig that was injected with both steriods and female hormones.

With the bad parts aside, lets talk about why this game is actually worth the $10.00 asking price. Let's be posh and give you a list of blunt statements:

- ALMOST 600 ARMOUR SETS, each with individual pieces: helmet, gauntlets, legs, torso, and boots.
- 200 different weapons
- Decent character customization (Though more hair options would be nice, other than just the 12 flavours of short available in 9 shades of brown.)
- Very easy to pick up and play.
- Puns of Damage. And lots of them. Some of them are even tolerable!
- Large open world, with tons of shiny loot, though I wish more of it could be placed in your house...which you can't have.

Over all, the hardcore gamer will find nothing of interest here. Fans of western RPG's will find an interesting mix of complete control over your character's destiny, and terrible, game breaking bugs such as randomly dying when you pick a lock to... 
A TENT? I can bloody see inside of it for the love of damn.

Para ser un juego del 2009, deja mucho que desear; los graficos y la jugabilidad no son malos pero si muy antiguos y personalmente me recordaron a juegos de rol 3D con tematica medieval como el juego Mu-Online. En si es un juego entretenido pero no es recomendable si estás acostumbrado a los juegos actuales; yo lo recomiendo solo si te gustan los juegos de esta tematica de entre los años 2000 a 2005, pero no esperes nada "épico" (como dice el nombre) a menos que seas fan de la saga.

Non so come descriverlo. Questo gioco mi ha fatto passare dall'esaltazione alla noia, dal divertimento al rimanere basito per svariate cose, più volte, in una sola partita. Ho il presentimento che sia un gioco con un progetto ambiziosissimo dietro, riuscito come un gioco mediocre per motivi di budget o forse per semplice pigrizia.

Il mondo è piuttosto ben realizzato per i tempi, ha i pregi e i difetti dei giochi suoi contemporanei, è bello da esplorare, le città sono abbastanza variegate tra di loro, ma non c'è "molto da guardare", non sprona all'esplorazione di ogni singolo angolo, perché in fondo non ce n'è motivo, se non per trovare la solita cassa saccheggiabile.

Ci sono quest molto belle, altre invece ridondanti, alcune side quest si accoppiano bene con la main quest e altre sono costruite molto bene sul mondo immaginario del gioco, la maggior parte peraltro. Missioni secondarie di sorprendente qualità, forse manca un pò di quantità. Mancano quasi totalmente le scelte, se ne possono fare molte poche e non influiscono DAVVERO sul gioco, salvo faide tra associazioni/gilde/clan, che nel più dei casi si concludono con l'annientamento di una delle due fazioni. Sistema di reputazione presso le fazioni interessante, ma probabilmente "sprecato", c'è anche qualche bug/omissione dei programmatori che permette di farla franca in alcuni casi: ho ammazzato la guardia del cancello in un insediamento, mi sarei aspettato l'odio del mondo intero come succede ad esempio in elder scrolls, invece non solo nessuno ha detto niente, ma il capoclan mi ha pure accolto in privato per discutere dei loro affari (lol).

Main quest che inizia col piede giusto, convince (se non addirittura costringe, ma a mio modo di vedere è positiva come cosa!) ad esplorare il mondo, o per lo meno i luoghi più importanti, ad interessarti di tutto ciò che sta dietro; la ho giudicata positivamente per la maggior parte del tempo, finché non mi son trovato di fronte ad alcune cose che mi han fatto concludere che il gioco è stato realizzato con fretta.

<SPOILER>

PRIMO:
Si deve raggiungere una città nel gioco, ashos mi pare, dove si trova uno degli oggetti da raccogliere per la main quest. Tale oggetto fa anche da custode religioso per gli abitanti della città, e frena gli orchi da eseguire un assedio con olocausto umano. Ecco, NON IMPORTA cosa voi facciate, potete radere al suolo un continente intero (continente che ci terrei a sottolineare per lo più vuoto, proprio vuoto, come un mondo curato a metà, da una parte molto bene, dall'altra trascurato), uccidere ogni orco sul pianeta, NON IMPORTA, la città viene invasa lo stesso dagli orchi nell'istante in cui voi poggiate le mani su quella fottuta reliquia.

falliscono quest all'istante (per cui se volete quel poco di xp/ricompense in cambio, dovete fare avanti e indietro nello stesso posto, che è ridondante), tutti gli abitanti muoiono, mercanti che muoiono ma i negozi non sono saccheggiabili (non c'è interazione con l'ambiente nel gioco), ne i loro inventari (date l'interpretazione che volete a questa cosa, non mi interessa), vi ritroverete ad uscir fuori in una città invasa da 2432325235 orchi, che oltre un certo livello schiaccerete con un dito, VOI DA SOLI li ammazzerete come foste terminator un armageddon di orchi, mentre un esercito di guardie giace morto a terra. Aggiungo: nessun segno di assedio, porta della città perfettamente in piedi, niente fiamme, niente di niente. Orchi materializzati in città che hanno ucciso persone: neanche la quest della guerra civile di skyrim era fatta in modo così trascurato. Questo è quello che io definisco "avere una bella idea e realizzarla MALISSIMO", anche perché le opportunità c'erano, e pure tante.

SECONDO:
La parte sopra è nulla in confronto a quello che sto per dire, perché è davvero qualcosa di indescrivibile. Perché in una città assediata senza assedio uno può dare la colpa magari agli strumenti, a developer poco esperti, a difficoltà che ti costringono a buttar fuori un gioco non al massimo del suo potenziale. Ma questo è qualcosa che non so davvero come descrivere.
A quella che è praticamente la fine della main quest, ci si incontra con un personaggio importante di questa associazione che ti ha "ingaggiato" all'inizio del gioco (ricattato a  dire il vero), e uno si aspetterebbe una cutscene o un lungo dialogo che spieghi cosa stia per succedere.

NO INVECE. NO.
Semplicemente NO. Non c'è nulla infatti. Nulla.
EDIT: ho sbagliato, ho controllato e ci sono delle cutscene nel gioco che però sono buggate e spesso non funzionano (come nel mio caso). Sono comunque ridicole. Ridicole e non spiegano NULLA di quello che succede.
Vieni indirizzato ad uccidere in una tra cinque torri elfiche a tua scelta un nemico facente parte dell'associazione nemica, per poi essere indirizzato al castello per la non-battaglia finale. Dico non-battaglia perché è davvero disarmante trovarsi al livello 51 e con una build tank disumana, con un pool di energia spaventoso, contro un nemico che ti one-shotta solo perché è gigante, brutto, cattivo e si chiama "demoniaco". E' davvero vergognoso fare un boss così. Un modo non-umano per ucciderlo è sfruttare la stupidità dell'IA, ovvero salire su una roccia e usare magie/archi per far fuori il nemico. Vorrei far notare che funziona così con quasi tutti i "nemici di grosse dimensioni" nel gioco. Oneshot o quasi ovunque. E chi non ha una build tank cosa fa, se prende uno schiaffo si trova la faccia nel sedere? eddai...
Ma comunque, il Boss non finale è seguito dal non-boss finale, che si rivela essere il tipo che ti ha ricattato/aiutato all'inizio del gioco (woooo che plot twist pazzesco, sarebbe stato anche piuttosto bello se ci fosse stata una storia dietro, ma non c'è quindi ci attacchiamo), che è un normalissimo spellsword che non ti uccide con un colpo solo, ha danni decisamente sensati, ma va giù molto facilmente, ma poco male, specie con la mia build.

Il fatto che mi rende più nervoso in assoluto è che qui ci DOVREBBE essere un finale, invece non c'è. Perchè ti ritrovi al menù principale. Non sai cosa sia successo a tua sorella, aziraal non si capisce che fine abbia fatto, non si capisce che fine fa il mondo in base alla decisione che prendi alla fine, NULLA. Un gioco tagliato. Immaginate di entrare nel Tempio dell'unico alla fine di oblivion, E IL GIOCO FINISCE Lì invece di esserci la scena finale con Martin/Akatosh e Mehrunes Dagon. Più o meno la dimensione è quella. semplicemente non c'è modo per descriverlo.

<FINE SPOILER>

Sistema di combattimento brutto, facciamola breve. L'idea che sta dietro non è poi così diversa da altri giochi (Prince of Persia, Assassin's creed), ma il guaio è che il gioco è tremendamente legnoso e un IA non proprio brillante peggiora le cose. Il più delle volte ci sono troppi nemici perché uno possa combatterli ragionevolmente (e quando dico troppi, voglio dire TROPPI), ma con una build tank come la mia, li butti giù tutti assieme con un colpo solo, salvo essere atterrato e non riuscire più ad alzarsi perché in mille ti stanno colpendo con colpi atterranti. Se non "brutto", tutto il sistema di combattimento è trascurato.

Non capisco come si possa giocare con una build arciere se non ci si può muovere con l'arco teso, senza rimanere in furtività (eddai...), o una build ladro con un sistema di furtività che si basa su spendere punti in un potere che non migliora te, ma rende ciechi i nemici (non sto scherzando, è così), o giocare con un mago senza dover in qualche modo obbligatoriamente spendere punti in vitalità.
Fine.
Gran juego de rol, me encanta la libertad de exploracion, juego algo viejillo con algunos fallos en el control del personaje, lo mejor es la libertad de exploración total, un 10 para mi.

The game itself feels like an old version of Skyrim. However there are so many small things in that game that totally ruin the game experience.

For me it felt like the game didn't scale - like it was expecting you to throw  it away after an hour of gameplay.
I was a level 65 mage in the end. I had the best possible staff at around lvl 15... 
Btw. you have 2x10 skill slots, but only 3 of them can contain spells. Most skills are pretty much useless. The AI could be tricked very easily. There were almost no items for high level characters - and the few which where there had the same stats as low level equipment.

I could go on about this, but I read that the second part is much better - so I am off to that one :P

Just started the game and already it feels good. I emplore anyone who loves RPG and Open World games to try it out. One problem i do see is that the combat is a bit... simple really. But it is something that adds to the game. Also i noticed that even though it doesnt have perfect graphics, it still looks really good and my crappy computer can handle it great.

Игра безусловно хорошая, РПГ-это всегда кайф,но вот только если вы не любите больших карт и море однообразных врагов,то лучше не стоит её брать. Минусы в том, что нет интересного боя, со временем бои с врагами становятся рутинными и молниеносными.Насчёт карты,она огромна и мне даже лень было её исследовать, ибо она тоже зачастую однообразна.Графон так себе,забудьте про него вообще.Диалоги тоже нудные и иногда не понятно о чём идёт речь, потому что русский язык в этой игре отсутствует.Короче,если вас всё это устраивает можете купить,но только со скидкой.)
Turrible, just palin turrible.... A complete waste of $1.38

Is the dialog goofy, perhance?  Aye, perchance!

That aside, this is a pretty decent Elder Scrolls style CRPG.  Big world to explore, lots of monsters to kill, quests to find, and factions to join or oppose.  The opening section seems to be one of the toughest, in terms of game balance, but once you're through that (and you realise that combining two items of the same type makes one stronger item) you'll be hacking your way through hordes of enemies in no time.

Ačkoli starší než Skyrim, grafický engine vytváří stromy (ne papírové kulisy ze školní besídky) a koně nejsou kamzíci :p. Grafika příjemná, příběh jasnější, možnosti RPG zajímavé. Ovládáním se mi líbí víc než konzoloidní hrůza TW2 (i když má TW2 lepší grafiku). Rád se k této hře vracím, v žánru RPG je hned druhá po NWN1. :)
I really enjoy this game, It is overshadowed by higher level, AAA Rpgs, Dont let the graphics and bad reviews throw you, a good game with alot of fun in store, especially the multiplayer,

I may have to pass on playing more of this game, it's a little dated by now. But it did look like a good game when I play it tho, kind of like The Elder Scrolls game's. Now Down To Business Two Worlds Epic Edition is a 7 out of 10.
Its interesting but VERY confusing
Scratches the MMO itch a bit.  Extremely difficult in the early game, but has some interesting ideas.  Looking forward to playing number 2 in 2015!

[b]I've made a terrible mistake.[/b]

While it is true that I never actually PLAYED the game, the amount of trouble this POS game gave me to get it to actually work was supremely frustrating.  But then the real kick in the jewels is that everything about the game is atrocious.  The graphics, the voice acting, the pacing, the introductory narrative that would have been written better by a prepubescent child completely improvising what's supposed to be the beginning of a riveting adventure story.  The world and the conflict feels cliche and boring.  There was no real character customization beyond an insultingly negligible character skin selection.

I wouldn't recommend this game at all to anyone under any circumstances ever.  Unless you hate having fun.  In which case play up.

Отличная игра, даже по сей день... а для своего времени вообще шедевр. Графика на уровне. сюжет увлекает, прокачка интересна, правда местами туповата. Имеются небольшое количество багов (например лошадь) - неприянтно, но игру не портит.

За полную цену покупать наверное не стоит, а вот со скидоном рекомендую.
Nice and long classic RPG

Одна из моих любимейших игр.
На нее было выпущено много патчей, которые привели баланс в игре в нормальное состояние. если быть объективным то оценка 7\10

TL;DR: This game is demonstrably bad, yet has a charm that lets it hold it's own against other rpg's of those days.

I will start this review with a warning: I'm biased in favor of this game. It was the first open world RPG I ever owned and so when I saw this game on steam the nostalgia hit like a thrown brick.

This is a game that you have to laugh at to play. If you are a fan of open world RPGs like me and are willing to keep a sense of humor, this is an excellent game despite the constant speed bumps.

The gameplay elements that work in this game's favor are the skills, crafting, and combat.

 The raw number of different skills allow the player to create a Robin Hood-esque ranger, a steel-clad one man-army warrior, or a mighty mage who owns an entire town (a bug I will explain later on).  The crafting system is simple, find two of the same items and you can combine them to make a single more powerful item.  The alchemy of Two Worlds is also the best type of potion-crafting I've ever experienced for a single reason: permanent effect potions and trap-making.  The combat is as varied as the classless skills, making any path viable. Using a wide variety of re-useable traps (from poisoned spikes to hammers and fire-coated blades) allows players who prefer ranged magic or bows to kill much more powerful creatures without the worry of being forced into melee. Magic and potions can keep a warrior alive in even the thickest melee.

While I do love this game, the experience fails in just as many ways as it succeeds. The game's skill system, combat, and crafting could all use some work.

I sound like I'm contradicting myself, but it is the truth. The way the player unlocks skills is by finding a trainer and purchasing the skill, which then allows the player to use and allocate points towards that skill. This is not a huge problem except for the alchemy skill. The alchemy skill is useable from the start of the game but the player must find the alchemy trainer (located far to the south and hidden among end-game monsters) in order to increase the skill, which is vital in wringing out every last stat point from permanent-effect potion ingredients. With the most useful early-game skill unlocked in the late/end-game, the other major skill dissapointments are the useless and annoying skills. You can learn a skill to unhorse a mounted enemy, but no one except the player can ride a horse. The swimming skill is useful for crossing rivers, which the player only really needs to do once or twice meaning the skill is a waste and swim-speed makes every river crossing a five-minute ordeal.

The combat, while the options are varried, can easily become stale.  Once you find a style that works, you will abuse it. For example: what should be an epic battle of ranger vs dragon becomes a chore as you trick the dumb-as-rock AI into alternating between stacks of traps as you fill it with arrows. 

The crafting system requires two of the same item to create a single more powerful version. However, if the two items are too different in their enchantments, you can't combine them. The only way to tell if an item is too different from your gear is to have them both in your inventory, making purchasing equipment a gamble at the best of times. 


The game has a few qualities that are neither inherently good or bad, as long as you keep a sense of humor. Perfect examples being the dialogue and the bugs.

The dialogue is comedic. It would be difficult for anyone to write funnier dialogue becuase between the merciless abuse of old-english and the uninspired voice acting, every single conversation will have you either cringing or laughing. 

The best bug I've ever experienced was in this game. *SPOILER ALERT*  During the course of the main questline, a city is overrun by orcs. By killing all the orcs and using the resurrect spell on everyone (including the orcs), the player can create a city where guards do not attack them and the humans and orcs co-exist peacefully (the orcs even sweep the streets) *SPOILER OVER*

While there are countless speed-bumps to enjoying this game (including the terrible activation), it is an experience worth having.

This game is one of the best RPG games I have played. The Map is huge and access is free around the map. There is no loss of scenery and no annoying gaps where you get stuck. I am not an expert gamer so I like a game to be reasonably easy without being killed constantly. I stopped playing Dungeon Siege III for that reason. The character development is similar to Gothic III. Creation of upgrade potions require experimentation but, once discovered, gives a new dimension to the game. I played this for many hours over Christmas and found the tasks and roleplay to be challenging and very enjoyable. There is no excess gore in fighting and the horse riding control is the best I've come across allowing for good combat on horseback with upgrade skills. Magic is easy to use and spells are upgradeable as you increase in levels and controls are easy considering the many options available. If you liked the Gothic series and Risen, I can recommend this game.

Эта игра вызвала у меня смешанные чувства. С одной стороны, передо мной предстала недо-RPG  с приличным кол-вом квестов, какой-никакой основной сюжетной линией, открытым миром и другими вещами, присущие сериям, вроде Elder Scrolls. Но сделано все, вообще все настолько криво, что хочется ее просто выключить и снести после пары квестов (поездки на лошади в этой игре не выветрятся из памяти еще очень долго). Думаю, что тот, кому неинтересен жанр и вся фэнтезийная мура, так и поступит. Но с другой стороны, мне, как человеку, который обожает серию Spellforce приглянулся сеттинг, да и сами ветки квестов. С геймплеем все вышло очень странно - лично я вкачал лучника, и уже к 20 уровню выносил все и вся по всему Талмонту. Качался до 60 уровня, пока просто не надоело, потом плюнул и выполнил основной квест за час, лол. Последний босс был вынесен одной-двумя стрелами. Несмотря на все это, игра смогла удержать меня аж на тридцатку часов.

Честно говоря, порекомендовать это я могу только любителям жанра. Здесь нет интересного сюжета, вменяемой прокачки, побочные квесты банальны и однообразны. Зато есть эти чертовы лошади. Но для себя я бы поставил 7 из 10. Просто за то, что мне нравятся такие сеттинги.

Wer "Rollenspielschwergewichte" wie Skyrim oder Oblivion kennt, ist hier genau richtig. Erfreulich auch hier, dass man nicht einen vorgefertigten Charakter an die Hand bekommt, sondern man selbst entscheidet, wie man sich im Laufe das Spiels entwickelt. Wer also denkt, er müsse eine dicke Rüstung tragen und gleichzeitig die übelsten Zaubersprüche wirken...kein Problem. Alles machbar mit der Skillung.
Ebenso simpel wie genial ist auch das Crafting. Hat man zwei identische Items (Rüstung, Waffe, Schmuck), zieht man sie einfach übereinander und schon ist aufgewertet. Und seinen Alchemiekessel hat man eh immer im Gepäck. Man muss also fürs komplette Handwerk weder Siedlungen noch Städte aufsuchen.
Da die Welt von "Two Worlds" wirklich riesig ist, komme ich hier auch zum einzigen Schwachpunkt in meinen Augen. Wenn man es so nennen kann: Abseits der Wege tut sich leider nicht ganz so viel wie in den obengennanten anderen Rollenspielen. Man findet zwar reichlich Wildtiere und Pflanzen für die Alchemie, aber für Entdecker und Erforscher ist es nicht ganz so spannend. Klar stolpert man hier und da über irgendwelche Dungeons oder Ruinen. Doch aufgrund der Grösse der Spielwelt wirkts fast ein wenig "leer". Dafür gibts jede Menge Banditen-, Ork- und Monsterlager in denen oft mehrere Kisten zum plündern rumstehen.
Trotzdem, zu tun gibts jede Menge, man wird reichlich versorgt mit Quests. Langeweile kommt also keine auf...und rumkommen tut man auch. Daher kommt auch ein Pferd sehr gelegen, an das man auf die verschiedensten Arten und Weisen gelangen kann. Leider ist hier die Steuerung etwas gewöhnungsbedürftig, aber nach kurzer Übung hat mans raus.

Amüsant sind auch die verschiedenen Gilden in diesem Spiel, für die man Jobs erledigen muss und somit Ruf erhält...was wiederum dem Ansehen zugute kommt. Da gibt es nämlich einige, die sich gegenseitig nicht so ganz "grün" sind. Da kann es dann schon vorkommen, das man die eine Gilde auslöschen soll, obwohl man doch für die grad wichitge Missionen erledigen soll. Und vorallem: was würde dann danach passieren? Vor solche Entscheidungen wird man übrigens öfters gestellt...und nicht nur von den Gilden.

Interessant ist auch der Aspekt, welche Rüstung ich für was benutze. Es gibt nämlich so einige, mit denen kann man z.B. nicht schwimmen oder keinen Bogen verwenden. Da wirds natürlich zur Gewissensfrage, ob ich die Teile trotzdem trage oder mir mehrere Sets ins Gepäck packe...so für alle Fälle. Da gehts dann natürlich wieder drum ob auch genug Platz in selbigem ist.
Apropos Items: ich war erstaunt wieviel unterschiedliche Waffen und Rüstungen es in diesem Spiel gibt. Und die haben auch wirklich ihren eigenen "Look".
Kurzum, wenn man bedenkt, dass das Spiel schon einige Jahre auf dem Buckel hat, wird man gut unterhalten und ich schätze mal die Spielzeit locker auf 50-80 Stunden. Kann bestimmt auch mehr sein, wenn man (so wie ich) seinen Nase überall und in jeden Winkel reinsteckt.
Ich selbst habe es übrigens auf einem Rechner mit Windows 7-64bit laufen und habe absolut keine Probleme damit. Also weder "Freezes" noch Abstürze.
perus peli...

RPG classic, surely there are some bugs and "not so pretty graphic", but the depth of the game and ideas that developers used in it - well, it definitely worth it. I played many RPGs and I can say that Two Worlds - is quite unique in this matter. I like the combat system (yes, it has some flaws, but still), I like inventory management and magic system. The characters and story is interesting as well. In short - buy it, it is "must have" for all those RPG fans out there.

Лучшая РПГ 2007 года.
Если, как мининмум, вы неравнодушны к хорошей рпг с огромным (!) открытым миром, то рекомендую вам эту игру.

I would highly reccommend this game to anyone looking for RPG Adventure games similar to the Elder Scrolls Saga. Decent graphics considering it is from 2007. I greatly enjoy the open world format, although, sometimes inventory space is an issue, especially when hoarding materials for when you reach level 10 Alchemy (Skill initially learned from a trainer without enhancements you have ot be level 24 to max skill). So far I am 37 hours in and I think it has a Good Story line. The teleport side quest is exceedingly helpful in making sure you don't have to leave any loots behind. Slight lag when it autosaves but otherwise runs smoothly.  Biggest disappointment thus far has been the inability to pickpocket from the NPC's. Word of Advice to those interrested in this game, use caution and consult google before diving head on into using alchemy, permanent indregient aren't very easy to come by and the brewing system is not intuitive on how to best maximise thier use.
Mayhap Methinks Perchance this is a solid Western RPG offering.  The issue is with the rather laughable dialog.
the game is awsome but if you you put the wrong sirial number you will be like me and can't play the game

Ive been looking for a game to play with a couple friends so when I saw this had multiplayer yea I had no problem paying 5 bucks for it, especially after reading the reviews. I kinda just wasted 5 bucks. There really isnt a multiplayer if you look into it. But the game also kinda blows as well. All these reviews keep saying its on the level of Oblivion but for real Id rather play morrowind than this. Obliviona dn most other rpgs tear this game aprt. The combat is awful, the enemies are incredibly hard, the animations really throw me off, the camera sucks, the dialog kills me to hear, and so on. The game does have an awesome amount of weapons and armor though. But the game just feels dead when I play it. The world feels sooo empty for an rpg. It kinda seems like someone was working on a rpg and they had an good idea but were like" #@!% it I dont feel like touching up al the crappy stuff" I really wanna like this game and I feel like it has so much potential but I just cant. But for real dont believe all these reviews talking about it being like oblivion and gothic. Theres a reason you've heard all about The Elder Scrolls and you have no idea what Two worlds is besides the fact you saw it was 5 bucks on steam.

Un jeu très bon pour l'époque ! Franchement même encore maintenant, graphiquement le jeu n'est pas moche ! Le scénario et les quêtes sont en revanche assez linéaires et on fait assez souvent la même chose sur la grande carte du monde (tuer un ennemi, amener des provisions ici, ramener un objet là-bas,...) notamment avec l'accumulation de multiples quêtes annexes. Il est en clair par contre que la performance en open world est vraiment appréciable ! Je n'ai pas eu la patience (ni d'intérêt réel) d'aller jusqu'au bout de l'aventure mais je le conseille à tous les rôlistes qui aiment le old school pas dégueulasse ! >> 14/20

A relatively old game, finished it for the second time now, and enjoeyed it more than the first time.

What I like
+ good graphics for the main character ( the armor & weapons look awasome )
+ pretty good graphics for the environment
+ action oriented rpg, you don't get to just walk around, you find stronger monsters everywhere 
+ motivational AI: you find monsters that kill you in one shot at first! So you grow stronger, until, in the end you feel like a god ( you fight the same monster, 5 - 10 in number )
+ no puzzles ( i don't like them )
+ simple but fun combat and spells
+ stacking armors/weapons of the same type ( if you find armors/weapons of same kind you can just combine it for something stronger )

What I didn't like
+ if you use a horse, quick save because you could get stuck in some textures ( rarely but happens )
+ awkward control with the horse
+ some animations could have been better
+ real doge ( you have a back dodge ), but a dodge controlled with arrrow keys makes the fight more dynamic
+ end game too easy. I was a god in the end, pre-boss took 5 max hits, and boss 2  hits. 
+ game crashes ( very rarely but happens ). I suggest to use quick save.

I recommend the game if:
+ you are an action RPG lover ( dislike rpgs with quests where you get 3 flowers, etc )
+ can make a compromise with some elements of graphics/animations
+ don't like puzzles, because there are none in this game

Otherwise, go and get it, you'll have a lot of fun

Cheers

I bought this game when it went on sale for $2 and I gotta say it was worth it. I was a bit worried after hearing all the negitive reviews but soon realized that most of the negitivity was coming from the xbox version. The PC version has better frames and better controls over the xbox. 

Pros: Great combat system, Tons of magic and abilities, Good monster variety, So many armor and weapon sets, Huge world filled with bandits and monsters roaming around, A lot of quests.

Cons: Bad voice acting, Some frame drops here and there, Mediocre story, Some character animations look a bit weird.

Overall its a great game. 8/10

In some ways, this game is better than Oblivion, the main competitor in the open-world fantasy genre, but there are quite a few issues and a real lack of polish that prevents the game from reaching its full potential.

The main gripe is combat. At later levels, the game becomes severely punishing. Now I don't mind difficulty, but this game likes  to suddenly throw overpowered monsters at you without warning. High level monster scale rediculously well. They will have a few times your health and do a couple times your damage. If you want to be able to take on high level challenges, you either have to grind out a lot of levels, which is done by killing monsters MMO style or through quests, or invest in the severely flawed magic system.

One can understand why the monster are so strong when one takes a look at what spells are available to the player. While finding the exact spell you want is nearly impossible, getting hands on any higher level spells makes your power level spike like crazy. I was able to get my hands on a reflect aura in the earth magic school. By abusing the magic system, I was able to get my reflect spell to reflect 70% of all damage. You heard that right, 70%. It seems the game will assume your use of of magic. By throwing out rediculous monsters, it forces you to be a sort of mage-warrior no matter what.

The leveling system in this game is actually more interesting than that of Oblivion's. There are a myriad of skills that can be learned, and the aforementioned magic system provides a bunch of really cool spells. Unfortunately, in terms of melee combat the game seems to favor two-handed weapons. The advantage of dual-wielding or using a sword and shield is the ability to parry attacks (done automatically). But one quickly realizes that isn't not worth it. It's far better to abuse the two-handed weapon's long range and simply physically avoid the ennemy blows, rather than nibling away at the enemy with the extremely short ranged one-handed weapons and relying on the dice to block strikes. It doesn't help that two-handed weapons all seem to deal double the damage of one handed weapons. 

In a role-playing game, the player should never be forced to do something. All roles should be equally valid. Whether that be a mighty barbarian or a graceful duelist. But the game funnels you down a single path. With some more polish and a better balanced combat and magic system, I might have really enjoyed this game. But these gaping issues ruined it for me.

This game was pretty nice and I don't understand such bad reviews it received. Yes, story was ok, not great, but somewhat rushed. In this game I actually liked graphics, I liked weapon and armor upgrade mechanics, even so they made little sense. Game gave you lots of choices as to where to explore and how to become more powerful. Some areas of the game felt a bit unfinished. Overall, it was a decent game.

Un juego realmente como lo dice su nombre "Epic", en si la saga entera Two Worlds (1 y 2) es excelente, una buena historia, un mundo RPG enorme, en el cual podemos explorar de distintas maneras, ya sea caminando (esto cansa, es mucho territorio jajajaja) por los portales una vez que los activamos es lo más rápido, o la mejor forma es a caballo, ya que se disfruta de todo el mundo abierto, la calidad gráfica y sonora del juego es excelente también, y los efectos de clima en tiempo real, como la noche y el día, o las tormentas, cuando caen rayos si están con volumen alto parece posta que está lloviendo jajajaja, algo interesante también son las muy amplias habilidades que tenemos para personalizar el personaje, ya sea con las mismas habilidades donde decidimos al 100% donde ponemos cada punto y por ende decidimos al 100% el personaje como evoluciona, el tema de las magias es dependiente de las habilidades también pero los poderes los asignamos mediante scrolls que nos equipamos teniendo principalmente 3 habilidades mágicas como acceso rápido, por otro lado también como otra rama podemos especializarnos en arqueria, hay una variedad de arcos y flechas con distintos atributos bastante grande, claro que también depende de como distribuimos los puntos del personaje, igual que con la magia, y la clase mas conocida, pero no menos importante es la de guerrero donde podemos usar una enorme cantidad de distintas armas que tiene el juego, algo muy bueno es el andar a caballo y aplastar a los enemigos, ya que al estar sobre un caballo nuestro daño aumenta considerablemente, también tenemos otras ventajas como el que el caballo funciona como inventario donde podemos guardar cantidad de items, sumado a esto el juego tiene la posibilidad de jugarlo "Online" de manera super simple y con muchos jugadores de todas partes, aclaro esto ya que hay juegos similares, que son "single player" y el "multiplayer" que trae o modo online, solo permite ejemplo 2 a 8 personas en una partida online, en la saga Two Worlds el modo online podemos conectarnos a los servers oficiales, donde los mismos son para partidas de 50 jugadores por "realm", con realm me refiero a que si entran a un server oficial "X" dentro de este tienen 10 sub servers por así decirlo que normalmente se los llama "realms" (en ingles) como término genérico en distintos MMORPG, bueno que mas que decir, la verdad un juego RPG que todo jugador de este género tiene que jugar, a este juego le doy un 9.4/10

I used to play this game all the time on Xbox 360 till they shut down the servers, but not i am so glad to have found that the euro servers are still ive on the PC version and i can connect with little lag and enjoy the game just like before. Just now i have to start over and get my spells and money back, looking forward to it non the less.

Any fan of RPG games must have this in their arsenal, one of my faves, lots of loot loads of quests and exploration to do, and nice touch with blunt weapons working better on skeletones while slashing or piercing weapons do little damage.
Many nice parts to this game, some do not like the speech due to it being a little cheesey, i personally find that it makes it more lovable.

This game never gets old! I love playing it and the quests are difficult but it kinda makes you think as you're running around fighting monsters how to solve problems and its a skill that can be used in the real world. Not everything in this game is just handed to you like most games now and its a good and bad thing. Overall this is a really good game expecially for this sale price. I definitely recommend this to a friend and i believe it even has online play. The horseback riding is kinda odd but when you really think about it, its more realistic than most other current games, horses won't just ride off a cliff in this and they wouldn't really in real life either. Its realistic in many ways, but nothings perfect.

Two Worlds II habe ich damals gesuchtet. Total Konkurrenzfähig zu damaligen Titel wie Gothic oder TES: Oblivion. Ich habe es sogar lieber gespielt als beide anderen. Waffen lassen sich auseinanderbauen und zu neuen kombinieren, mit Verstärkungen versehen. Alchimie. große Skillbaum. Magie. Traglast. Der Hauptcharakter hat den Charme von Gothic Teilen und ist manchmal sogar noch flockiger in seinen Sprüchen. Ich hoffe es wird einen Teil 3 geben und wenn ja ist er instant gekauft. Habe mir das komplette Two Worlds Paket gekauft um auch im Genuss des ersten Teils zu kommen und bin auch trotz etwas schlechterer Grafik und nur ein paar Minuten Ingame wieder Feuer und Flamme für die Serie. ein paar kleiner glitches die aber nich sehr ins Gewicht fallen.
Необычная и захватывающая игра.

Awesome roleplaying game great graphics and epic story. The beginning is very hard you have to take your time and build up be patient, dont dive into combat or you die. learn the jump back system for defense. The horse riding is better than any rpg ive played for realism, you can shoot your bow while riding horses. The combat system is very fun once you get comfortable with the way your character moves. THere is an ingenious way to stack equipment so nothing gets wasted and items lvl as they are stacked into eachother. There are hours and hours of content and side stories. The magic system is fantastic. This was due to buggyness rated as one of the worst RPGs but infact i find its one of the best RPGS now with the patching. I prefer this game over oblivion 10 to 1. The characters are more robust. Some people complain about the voice acting but its appropriate for the setting the old english. Also its nice to hear your character talk instead of read what he says as a mute as in most games.  There is plenty of element of exploration. This is a recommended must buy for anyone who likes skyrim,oblivion, gothic or any open world RPG 3rd person games. Also this game has some of the best looking armor sets ive ever seen in a game and the most veriety of weapons and items in any game to date.

I love this game!! LOVE IT! This game is a bit old, sure, but it is so fun to wonder in its world. Exploring is never inhibited by anything else, you want to go see what that tower is for? Go for it. The quests are simple enough to follow and all add to the overall feel of the world.

You get to customize your character's abilities as you see fit. For example, I'm a Necromancing Swordsman and I am GOD! In my world anyway. 

Play it!

Get this game if you aren't afraid of warriors, hard ones. You're the kind of hero who prefers to narrate everything you do, all the while sounding like the last guy who told your drunk ass to get in the trunk. The kind of hero with the air of a repeat sex offender who eats nails for breakfast, but possesses a warm gooey center and extremely mixed feelings about their scantily clad sister who looks nothing like them 99.9% of the time. If you feel like chasing the big bad hard warrior known as Gandohar and is sensible but stylish  master named Reist across the damn continent to save your sister prepare yourself for a twist that would probably make M. Night Shablabdingdong proud. 


Note that it will cause everyone else to indifferently stare at the screen while fiddling with their genitalia. Oh yeah you kill a lot of things and get progressively shinier armor to protect you from (or attract) Gandohars firm hands, its all fun and games till the bad guy starts caressing you like  you're his pillow. Also this game is a fantastic substitute for Blender Simulator 2013, I'd like to see those sim punks make an even better identical sword by throwing 20 of them in a blender together!




Seriously though Two Worlds has...

Symbol Key
--------------------
++= very good
+= good
- = bad
--------------------

- Hilarious voice acting (yes its bad but in a good way) + 

- Exploration! ++

- Some Forgettable quests -

- Plenty of quests +

- Plentiful factions but no real consequences for reputation other than more or less quests =

The combat is somewhat difficult but unlike other games you can't permanently die, you'll just get ressurected at a nearbly Maliel Shrine and continue your journey back to that damn Cyclops that used your helmet as a bongo. No item loss, no nothing, just rinse and repeat till you win (quicksaving in other RPG's is kind of the same thing though). Did I mention the map is huge and full of diverse and fairly interesting environments complete with some fairly standard but servicable guilds/factions to be a part of? 


Whether you're slaying Jackals and Dragons in the desert, killing Polar Bears and Orcs up in the glacier, being chased through the ruins of the deadlands surrounding a destroyed city with appropriate amounts of demons, undead, and more. Maybe you'll just slaughter entire cities and towns for fun once you become powerful enough? Just don't beat the main quest right away as once its over so is the game, its a lot more fun to explore the exotic landscapes of Antaloor and though they may lack much lore to give them added signifigance, its always the journey that beats the destination. Good thing the journey is so damn fun.


Yes the voice acting is THAT bad and you will love it! Its part of the games charm.


7.7/10
